_comment: Configuration template for the time-series-forecaster plugin.
Name of the forecasting model to use. Options: Prophet, ARIMA, ExponentialSmoothing. Default: Prophet

model_parameters._comment: Parameters specific to the chosen model.

Prophet._comment: Parameters for the Prophet model (https://facebook.github.io/prophet/docs/parameters.html). Leave empty to use defaults.
List of dates at which to include potential changepoints. If None, potential changepoints are automatically placed.
Number of potential changepoints to place automatically.
Proportion of history in which trend changepoints will be estimated.
Fit yearly seasonality. Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate.
Fit weekly seasonality. Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate.
Fit daily seasonality. Can be 'auto', True, False, or a number of Fourier terms to generate.
Pandas DataFrame of holidays with columns 'ds' (date) and 'holiday' (holiday name).
Parameter modulating the strength of the seasonality model.
Parameter modulating the strength of the holiday model.
Parameter modulating the flexibility of the automatic changepoint selection.
Number of MCMC samples to draw. If 0, will do point estimates.
Width of the uncertainty intervals provided for the forecast.
Number of simulated draws used to estimate uncertainty intervals.
The Stan backend to use. Valid options are: null (default), 'CMDSTANPB', and 'PYSTAN'.

ARIMA._comment: The number of lag observations included in the model, also called the order of the AR part.
The number of times that the raw observations are differenced, also called the degree of differencing.
The size of the moving average window, also called the order of the MA part.
The (P,D,Q,s) order of the seasonal component of the model for seasonality of period s (often 4 or 12). Can be set to None if there is no seasonal component.

Parameter controlling the deterministic trend. Can be a string ('n', 'c', 't', 'ct') or a list of regressor names. 'n' - no trend, 'c' - constant only, 't' - time trend only, 'ct' - constant and time trend.

ExponentialSmoothing._comment: Parameters for the Exponential Smoothing model (https://www.statsmodels.org/stable/generated/statsmodels.tsa.holtwinters.ExponentialSmoothing.html).
The number of periods in a complete seasonal cycle.
Type of trend component. Options: 'add', 'mul', None.
Type of seasonal component. Options: 'add', 'mul', None.
Should the trend component be damped?
Method for initializing the recursions. Options: 'estimated', 'heuristic', 'known'.
Should the Box-Cox transform be applied to the data?

_comment: Frequency of the time series data. Options: 'D' (daily), 'W' (weekly), 'M' (monthly), 'Q' (quarterly), 'Y' (yearly), etc.
Number of periods to forecast into the future.
Confidence level for the forecast intervals.
Metric to use for evaluating model performance. Options: 'rmse', 'mae', 'mse'.

cross_validation._comment: Amount of time to train the model initially. Example: '365 days', '6 months'.
Spacing between cutoff dates. Example: '90 days', '3 months'.
Size of the forecast horizon. Example: '30 days', '1 month'.

feature_engineering._comment: Add lagged values of the time series as features.
Number of lags to add if add_lags is true.

_comment: Format of the forecast output. Options: 'json', 'csv'.
Name of the dataset for identification purposes.
